children.subject:
As of now, the staff will be working to convert the labs to be done remotely.

The school hasn't really explicitly defined what a hybrid semester entails or what rules/restrictions would be put into place so right now we can't say for sure if we will need to still have our labs done remotely if the school chooses to have a hybrid semester. We would love to use our robots and expose our students to working with hardware but obviously the safety of our students comes first so we will need to wait for the school's official decision before making one of our own. 

If we can safely use the lab next semester (pending school approval), we will be offering in-person labs. Additionally, we will be offering online/virtual labs for students who are unable to attend in-person lab sections. If school is pushed to all online, we will have exclusively online labs. Please note though that you'll be learning different kinds of skills through the online route vs the traditional in-person labs!
A followup to this -- if the semester will be entirely online in the fall, are there any talks of there being another in-person offering of 106A (potentially in the spring)?
Most likely not as 106b/206b uses the same lab room and the same robots as 106a/206a. There just isn’t enough space or hardware to offer both classes in the same semester.

How much would you bet the university is going to offer in-person labs? To a certain degree, I'm basing housing decisions on this class.

Are there ways to replicate in-person labs/projects with sufficient equipment at home?

I really can’t comment on what the school’s going to decide because I honestly don’t know so I don’t think I can help you very much in making this decision. All the information I have about their possible decision is what the school has announced to everyone in schoolwide emails. 

For the labs, we normally use Baxter, Sawyer, and turtlebot robots. All of which aren’t robots you could easily get yourself and set up at home. We’ll be using simulation software and virtual machines in order to create online, remote versions of these labs instead. 

The final project is much more open ended and you can use any sort of robot or robotics equipment available to you (although we will of course be making some changes to our expectations and guidelines to allow for some more flexibility and wiggle room if students will be unable to use our robots and/or will not have access to their own). In past semesters, most students used our robots for their projects but again this is not a requirement.
Given the recent email, is there any update on this?

We are still waiting for the school to let us know if we can safely have any students in the lab space. All they've really announced is a plan for a hybrid semester. They haven't told us how many students per square feet we are allowed to have or anything yet and our lab space is already on the small side so we are unsure if we will be able to have any students safely work there. Online versions of the lab will be available regardless though.
Will labs/projects be held in person (if there's hybrid) or  will they be entirely online no matter what?

history.content:
Hi folks,

EECS/BioE 106A/206A is hiring for Fall 2020! We are looking to hire TAs/GSIs, lab assistants, and readers. 
If you're interested in helping teach the course, please fill out this form by our priority deadline, June 12th: https://forms.gle/RD27EaCLBNN3nEHe7
We look forward to seeing your responses!

Best,
Amay, Tiffany, and Stella
history.subject: F20: EECS 106A/206A Hiring Now!
